required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intense Pulsed Light in Meibomian Gland Dysfunctions
clinical_study.official_title: Intense Pulsed Light in Meibomian Gland Dysfunctions: Retrospective Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

clinical_study.source: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

brief_summary.textblock:
Dry eye disease (DED) is an extremely common disease whose meibomian gland dysfunction is the main etiology.
Polychromatic intense pulsed light (IPL) is a promising new therapeutic alternative but few clinical data have been published.
A new IPL device has recently been marketed: LACRYSTIM (QUANTEL, France). The investigators have been using it in our clinical practice since June 2019.
The investigators present a retrospective study on our first clinical results.

primary_outcome.description: The LacryDiag ocular surface analyzer is used for the diagnosis of dry eyes.

secondary_outcome.description: -data concerning the safety: presence or absence of adverse events during treatment or afterwards (burns, tingling, redness of skin ...)

measured in current clinical practice. This 12-item questionnaire assesses dry eye symptoms and the effects it has on vision-related function in the past week of the patient's life. The questionnaire has 3 subscales: ocular symptoms, vision-related function, and environmental triggers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Slit lamp Photography x16 and x25

secondary_outcome.description: measured in current clinical practice. The Oxford score is used to assess epithelial damage to the cornea and conjunctiva.
measured in current clinical practice. The measurement of the tear film rupture time determines the stability of the tear film, i.e. the degree of humidification of the eyes.
measured in current clinical practice. Determination of the quantity of tears produced.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients with dry eye disease with meibomian gland dysfunction
arm_group.description: Collected data from patient records for consultations Day 0, Day 15 and Day 45 (3 treatment sessions) and Months 3, Months 6 (follow-up consultations). - parameters used for each treatment session: duration of treatment session and intensity of intense pulsed light

intervention.description: collection data : parameters used for each treatment session: duration of treatment session and intensity of intense pulsed light
intervention.arm_group_label: Patients with dry eye disease with meibomian gland dysfunction

study_pop.textblock: Patients with Dry eye disease with meibomian gland dysfunction, preferentially mild to moderate, and having benefited from intense pulsed light treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with Dry eye disease with meibomian gland dysfunction, preferentially mild to moderate, and having benefited from intense pulsed light treatment.
- patient affiliated with a social security organization
Exclusion Criteria:
- patient with incomplete follow-up
